title: 107_s2187
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002" authorizes the Department to provide health care during major disasters and medical emergencies. The Department of Veterans Affairs can provide hospital care and medical services during major disasters and emergencies, regardless of veterans' enrollment status. This is authorized under the "Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002." The Department of Veterans Affairs can provide care and services to veterans during disasters or emergencies, regardless of their enrollment status. Priority may be given to veterans and active-duty members of the Armed Forces, with reimbursement agreements for care provided to non-Department employees. The Department of Veterans Affairs can provide care and services to veterans during disasters or emergencies, regardless of enrollment status. Reimbursement agreements for care provided to non-Department employees must be agreed upon by the Secretary and the head of the department or agency. Amounts received will be credited to the Department facility that provided the care. The Secretary must submit a report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs within 60 days of a disaster or emergency, detailing the allocation of facilities and personnel for providing care and services. Regulations governing the Secretary's authority under this section will be prescribed. During disasters or emergencies, the Department of Veterans Affairs can provide care and services to veterans, including active duty members of the Armed Forces. The Secretary may furnish hospital care, nursing home care, and medical services to members of the Armed Forces during war, national emergencies, or disasters. During and immediately following a disaster or emergency, the Secretary can provide hospital care and medical services to active duty members of the Armed Forces. The priority for care under this section is higher than for any other group, except for veterans with service-connected disabilities. The terms 'hospital care', 'nursing home care', and 'medical services' are defined in this section.
